title: Tutorial: Use Cases
text: two use cases using FishLife obtain missing Life History Traits (LHTs): ) want evaluate species biological parameters available, meaning need retrieve FishLife-predicted LHTs desired taxon. ii) biological parameters , use FishLife generate new set parameters integrates updates existing data. section deals case .

title: Tutorial: Use Cases
text: csv file taxon names wanted LHTs seeking required.csv shows columns LHTs , shown . wrapper uses list map column names csv actual names used FishLife. predicted variable names change FishLife future, may need tweak list. See list member R6 object called fishlife_context. nothing changed FishLife, unless need add wanted parameters, nothing else required . Likewise, back-transform obtained predicted variables LHTpicker provides function map predicted variables required function convert . previously mentioned, may need touch list either.
code: taxon_lhts_to_fetch <- readRDS("data/wanted_taxon_details.rds") head(taxon_lhts_to_fetch) #>                   taxon Linf Winf  K L50  M Amat Amax Temperature #> 1    Trisopterus luscus   NA   NA NA  NA NA   NA   NA          NA #> 2 Pollachius pollachius   NA   NA NA  NA NA   NA   NA          NA LHTpicker::fishlife_context$lht_names #> $Linf #> [1] "log(length_infinity)" #>  #> $Winf #> [1] "log(weight_infinity)" #>  #> $K #> [1] "log(growth_coefficient)" #>  #> $M #> [1] "log(natural_mortality)" #>  #> $L50 #> [1] "log(length_maturity)" #>  #> $Amax #> [1] "log(age_max)" #>  #> $Amat #> [1] "log(age_maturity)" #>  #> $Temperature #> [1] "temperature" LHTpicker::fishlife_context$backtransform_function_list #> $`log(length_infinity)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(weight_infinity)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(growth_coefficient)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(natural_mortality)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(length_maturity)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(age_max)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $`log(age_maturity)` #> function (x)  .Primitive("exp") #>  #> $temperature #> function (x)  #> x #> <bytecode: 0x557b4f034c40> #> <environment: namespace:base>

title: Tutorial: Use Cases
text: Please refer reference details. case FishLife provide details species whatever reason, LHTpicker return column NA values rows holding details missing species, shown .
code: p_lht_picker <- LHTpicker::PredictedLHTPicker$new(FishLife::FishBase_and_Morphometrics,                                                   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$lht_names,                                                   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$backtransform_function_list,                                                   taxon_lhts_to_fetch) predicted_lht_df <- p_lht_picker$pick_and_backtransform() head(predicted_lht_df) #>                   taxon     Linf      Winf         K      L50         M #> 1    Trisopterus luscus 43.86770  833.9878 0.3737931 19.52203 0.5981946 #> 2 Pollachius pollachius 87.30785 5819.9735 0.1867131 34.71789 0.3085845 #>       Amat      Amax Temperature #> 1 1.400562  6.458926    17.36961 #> 2 3.456610 12.138258    12.11773 non_existant_taxon_lhts_to_fetch <- dplyr::mutate(taxon_lhts_to_fetch, taxon = dplyr::case_when(     taxon == "Trisopterus luscus" ~ "IDoNoExist",     .default = taxon )) p_lht_picker <- LHTpicker::PredictedLHTPicker$new(FishLife::FishBase_and_Morphometrics,                                                   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$lht_names,                                                   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$backtransform_function_list,                                                   non_existant_taxon_lhts_to_fetch) predicted_lht_df <- p_lht_picker$pick_and_backtransform() head(predicted_lht_df) #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   taxon                  Linf  Winf      K   L50      M  Amat  Amax Temperature #>   <chr>                 <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 IDoNoExist             NA     NA  NA      NA   NA     NA     NA          NA   #> 2 Pollachius pollachius  87.3 5820.  0.187  34.7  0.309  3.46  12.1        12.1

title: Tutorial: Use Cases
text: csv file taxon names wanted--update LHTs required shown . Let’s suppose LHTs however know natural mortality(M) age maturity.
code: taxon_lhts_to_update <- readRDS("data/wanted_update_taxon_details.rds") head(taxon_lhts_to_update) #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   taxon                  Linf  Winf     K   L50 M     Amat   Amax Temperature #>   <chr>                 <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl> <lgl> <dbl>       <dbl> #> 1 Trisopterus luscus     42.4   921 0.21   19.4 NA    NA        9        14.3 #> 2 Pollachius pollachius 102.  12045 0.193  41.6 NA    NA        8        14.3

previous_headings: 3 Fetch updated LHTs given new data
title: Tutorial: Use Cases
text: Unless previous function, need provide two extra parameters: prefix LHTpicker use concatenate named updated columns csv function transformation list, similar back-transformation one, transform provided LHTs Fishlife’s expected domain. , unless need variables FishLife, need modify neither related transformation back-transformation lists. See updated column name FishLife prefix attached updated_M Amat now provided. order use LHTs assessment need use whole returned set, avoid breaking covariance matrix among parameters (Thorson et al., 2017)
code: u_lht_picker <- LHTpicker::UpdatedLHTPicker$new(   FishLife::FishBase_and_Morphometrics,   taxon_lhts_to_update,   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$updated_prefix,   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$transform_function_list,   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$backtransform_function_list,   LHTpicker::fishlife_context$lht_names ) updated_lht_df <- u_lht_picker$pick_and_backtransform() head(updated_lht_df) #>                   taxon   Linf  Winf     K   L50  M Amat Amax Temperature #> 1    Trisopterus luscus  42.41   921 0.210 19.45 NA   NA    9        14.3 #> 2 Pollachius pollachius 102.14 12045 0.193 41.60 NA   NA    8        14.3 #>   updated_Linf updated_Winf updated_K updated_M updated_L50 updated_Amax #> 1     44.01880     839.5509 0.3451741 0.5872462    19.60257     6.973144 #> 2     95.04985    8387.9049 0.1881105 0.2997824    36.48049    11.111069 #>   updated_Amat updated_Temperature #> 1     1.438878            16.75299 #> 2     3.413651            13.05912

code: @Manual{,   title = {LHTpicker: Fishlife LHT picker},   author = {Dan G},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://d2gex.github.io/LHTpicker/}, }

title: Fishlife LHT picker
text: thin wrapper FishLife library helps abstract underlying data structure final user, easing fetching update Life History Traits (LHTs). following processes integrated: Fetch predicted LHTs FishLife individual taxon. Provide FishLife ‘predicting’ LHTs fetch updated predicted values back FishLife individual taxon. Streamline processes aforementioned multiple taxa. CSV input used cases. Note wrapper tested LHTs included original version software (Thorson et al., 2017), utilising latest FishLife interface (Thorson et al., 2023). Consequently, likely compatible additional parameters introduced subsequent updates. Since 2017, new predicted parameters various types incrementally added (Thorson et al., 2017, 2023; Thorson, 2020).” wrapper designed handle potential name changes predicted variables resulting FishLife updates. ensure compatibility, simply provide LHTpicker mapping updated field names.” Please look tutorial understand whole thing works.

title: Fishlife LHT picker
text: R package can installed devtools follows:

title: Fishlife LHT picker
text: Thorson, J. T., S. B. Munch, J. M. Cope, J. Gao. 2017. Predicting life history parameters fishes worldwide. Ecological Applications. 27(8): 2262–2276. http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/eap.1606/full Thorson, J.T., 2020. Predicting recruitment density dependence intrinsic growth rate fishes worldwide using data-integrated life-history model. Fish Fish. 21, 237–251. https://doi.org/10.1111/faf.12427 Thorson, J.T., Maureaud, .., Frelat, R., Mérigot, B., Bigman, J.S., Friedman, S.T., Palomares, M.L.D., Pinsky, M.L., Price, S.., Wainwright, P., 2023. Identifying direct indirect associations among traits merging phylogenetic comparative methods structural equation models. Methods Ecol. Evol. n/. https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.14076

title: Fishlife Context class — FishlifeLHTNameSpace
text: Class allows transition user-defined LHT names specifically used Fishlife

title: Fishlife Context class — FishlifeLHTNameSpace
text: updated_prefix string added obtained LHT FishLife lht_names User-defined list LHT names associated expected FishLife names transform_function_list Forward function conversion required user-defined parameter. backtransform_function_list Backward function conversion required obtained LHT value.

title: Fishlife Context class — FishlifeLHTNameSpace
Fishlife Context class — FishlifeLHTNameSpace
Fishlife Context class — FishlifeLHTNameSpace
code: FishlifeLHTNameSpace$new(   updated_prefix = "updated",   lht_names = list(Linf = "log(length_infinity)", Winf = "log(weight_infinity)", K =     "log(growth_coefficient)", M = "log(natural_mortality)", L50 =     "log(length_maturity)", Amax = "log(age_max)", Amat = "log(age_maturity)",     Temperature = "temperature"),   transform_function_list = list(`log(length_infinity)` = log, `log(weight_infinity)` =     log, `log(growth_coefficient)` = log, `log(natural_mortality)` = log,     `log(length_maturity)` = log, `log(age_max)` = log, `log(age_maturity)` = log,     temperature = base::identity),   backtransform_function_list = list(`log(length_infinity)` = exp, `log(weight_infinity)`     = exp, `log(growth_coefficient)` = exp, `log(natural_mortality)` = exp,     `log(length_maturity)` = exp, `log(age_max)` = exp, `log(age_maturity)` = exp,     temperature = base::identity) )
